title.text: Detecting Dependencies between Semantic Verb Subclasses and Subcategorization Frames in Text Corpora

abstractContent.text: We present a method for individuating dependencies between the semantic class of predicates and their associated subcategorization frames, and describe an implementation which allows the acquisition of such dependencies from bracketed texts.

introductionContent.text: There is a widespread belief among linguists that a predicate's subcategorization frames are largely determined by its lexical-semantic properties.
Consider the domain of movement verbs.
Following Talmy, these can he semantically classified with reference to the meaning components: MOTION, MANNER, CAUSATION, THEME (MOVING ENTITY), PATH AND REFERENCE LOCATIONS (GOAL, SOURCE).
Lexicalization patterns which arise from identifying clusters of such meaning components in verb senses can be systematically related to distinct subcategorization frames.
